meanings.sent1: The special material was thermoduric, able to endure extreme heat without melting.
meanings.sent2: The oven gloves were made of a thermoduric fabric to protect the hands from burns.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream didn't stand a chance against the thermoduric sun, quickly turning into a puddle.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as thermoduric as steel, never wavering even in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was surprisingly thermoduric, surviving centuries of exposure to harsh climates.

meanings.sent1: Scientists discovered a new thermoduric species living near the volcanic vents.
meanings.sent2: The desert is home to many thermoduric creatures adapted to the scorching temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The thermoduric bacteria in the hot spring seemed to be enjoying their steamy jacuzzi.
meanings.sent4: In the competition of endurance, the thermoduric organisms proved their resilience under fire.
meanings.sent5: The survival of the fittest was evident as the thermoduric plants thrived in the harsh environment.

meanings.sent1: The thermoduric material was perfect for insulating the electronics from overheating.
meanings.sent2: The chef's thermoduric hands could handle the hot pans without any discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The thermoduric sunscreen protected her skin from the scorching sun during the beach day.
meanings.sent4: His calm demeanor remained thermoduric even in the heat of the argument.
meanings.sent5: The thermoduric glass reflected the sunlight, keeping the interior cool and comfortable.
